DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (MSAS) 7-12 Yesterday or Today How Worried Score 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how worried they felt yesterday or today, using a three-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (MSAS) 7-12 Yesterday or Today How Worried Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated questionnaire designed to evaluate the prevalence, characteristics, and distress to young children with cancer aged 7-12. This 8-question instrument was adapted from a previously-validated adult version._The time period consisting of the current day and the preceding day._A question about how worried an individual felt._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated questionnaire designed to evaluate the prevalence, characteristics, and distress to young children with cancer aged 7-12. This 8-question instrument was adapted from a previously-validated adult version.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-10) How Worried 3 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (A little) to 3 (Very much) on a Likert scale used on the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-12) questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something occurs with little frequency or intensity.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something occurs with little frequency or intensity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is or was of a moderate amount, intensity, or duration.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is or was of a moderate amount, intensity, or duration.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

DataElement.origin: MSAS 7-10: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (7-10). J. Collins, et al. Journal of Pain and Symptom Management. 2002 Jan; 23(1): 10-16
